topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the Horizon Region Switcher Patch

section.p: This patch must be applied only after the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is fully deployed for the Denver and Tahoe cloud topologies.

Note: If you applied the Horizon-002 Patch, horizon-region-switcher.patch during installation and can switch between regions in Horizon (for example, from the Overview panel). You can disregard these steps.
This patch fixes a problem that the prevents the user from switching between regions in Horizon. .

body.section:
Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the patch and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the directory is available.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p:
Before installing the patch, make sure::
The lifecycle manager VM node is up and running
The Horizon Provider Network Patch (providernet-tab-missing-in-horizon) was applied is already applied
If you have updated any files in the /opt/share/hlm/site/services directory, make a backup of that directory. For information on using the Attis backup and restore application, see Backup and Restore.

section.title: Install the patch
section.p: The patch is in a compressed file called . The README with the patch download contains information on files changed by these patches.

ol.li:
Log onto the lifecycle manager VM.ssh <HLM_VM_IP>
where: HLM_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.
Copy the file to the /root/ directory.
Execute the following command to deploy the patch: patch -p1 < ../horizon-region-switcher.patch
Execute the following command to integrate the changes into the environment:./hlm_prepare-env.sh
Execute the following command:hlm generate -c <cloud name>
Execute the following command to redeploy the Horizon UI: hlm deploy -c <cloud name> -t "WR-HZN"

section.title: Verify the patch
section.p: After applying the patch, log into Horizon. You should by default be logged into WR region which is "regionone"
Note: The region drop-down in Horizon continues to show non-KVM region, but nothing will happen when you select the non-KVM region.
